**Goals**
=========

The primary goal of this class is to enhance students’ development of their scientific writing and presentation skills. Students will develop the English reading and writing skills necessary to comprehend and produce journal articles in their specialized field. Students will also discuss and develop the skills they will need to present their research in a seminar or at an international conference.

**Requirements**
================

**1.  Attendance and Preparation**: This is a skill-based course. It is expected that you will attend class weekly to discuss and practice the skills that are the focus of the course. If you fail to attend class, or miss class frequently, it will affect your final grade. Prior to class, please prepare any assigned readings and complete any assigned tasks.

**2.  Participation**: It is expected that students will be active participants in the learning process. 

Grading

Your final grade will be based on:

1.  There are two choices: a final research paper based on your own research or a review paper based on a topic in physics you are interested in.
2.  Three presentations. One will be from the textbook, one on a science article of interest to the general public, and the final one will relate to the research or review paper you will submit at the end of the semester.
3.  As noted above, students are expected to attend class on a regular basis and participate in class discussion. There will be many in-class writing and speaking activities related to the textbooks and other readings, and there will also be some short take-home writing assignments.    

Final Research Paper                                                                    20%
